intro: Hybanthus caffer, commonly known as the African yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters. Hybanthus caffer is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
